subject: Re: [junit] @TimeoutSuite, how do I pass this as a parameter on the command line
msgSnippet: Thanks Dawid! This was what I was looking for ... Regards, -NN ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Thanks Dawid! This was what I was looking for ...

Regards,
-NN

On 9/9/2012 11:32 PM, Dawid Weiss wrote:
>
> If you mean this:
> http://labs.carrotsearch.com/download/randomizedtesting/2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/api/randomizedtesting-runner/com/carrotsearch/randomizedtesting/annotations/TimeoutSuite.html
>
> then you're using the wrong mailing list because that's not part of
> standard JUnit.
>
> Anyway, the answer would be the number of milliseconds followed by "!" (to
> override any annotations, otherwise it's just a default for non-annotated
> classes).
>
> -Dtests.timeoutSuite=1000!
>
> Dawid
>
> On Sun, Sep 9, 2012 at 9:39 PM, nn89210 <nn89210@...
> <mailto:nn89210%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
>
> > **
> >
> >
> > Hi!
> >
> > Is there a way to pass the TimeoutSuite as a parameter on the
> command line
> > when I start the test ?
> >
> > Thanks,
> >
> >
> >
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
